app.title: Google Photos
app.description:
Google Photos is the home for all your photos and videos, automatically organized and easy to share.

- “The best photo product on Earth” – The Verge
- “Google Photos is your new essential picture app” – Wired

The official Google Photos app is made for the way you take photos today and includes essential features like shared albums, automatic creations and an advanced editing suite. Additionally every Google Account comes with 15 GB of storage and you can choose to automatically back up all your photos and videos in High quality or Original quality. You can then access them from any connected device and on photos.google.com.

With the official app, you get:

15 GB OF STORAGE: Back up 15 GB of photos and videos and access them from any device and photos.google.com—your photos are safe, secure, and private to you. All photos and videos you back up in high quality before June 1, 2021 will not count toward your Google Account storage.

FREE UP SPACE: Never worry about running out of space on your phone again. Photos that are safely backed up can be removed from your device's storage in just a tap.

NO ADS: Google Photos doesn't sell your photos, videos, or personal information to anyone and we don't use your photos and videos for advertising.

FAST AND POWERFUL SEARCH: Your photos are now searchable by the people, places and things in them — no tagging required.

GOOGLE LENS: Search the hard-to-describe and get stuff done, right from a photo. Copy and translate text, identify plants and animals, add events to your calendar, find products online, and more.

ADVANCED EDITING SUITE: Transform photos with a tap. Use intuitive and powerful photo editing tools to apply content-aware filters, adjust lighting, and more.

AUTOMATIC CREATIONS: Bring photos to life with automatically created movies, collages, animations, panoramas, and more from your photos. Or easily create them yourself.

SHARING SUGGESTIONS: With smart sharing suggestions, giving your friends the photos you took of them is painless. And they can add their photos, too, so you’ll finally get the photos you’re actually in.

LIVE ALBUMS: Select the people and pets you want to see and Google Photos will automatically add photos of them as you take them, no manual updates needed.*

PHOTO BOOKS: Create a photo book in just minutes from your phone or computer. You can also see suggested photo books based on your best shots from a trip or period of time.*

SEND PHOTOS IN SECONDS: Instantly share photos with any contact, email, or phone number.

SHARED LIBRARIES: Grant a trusted person access to all of your photos.

You can also upgrade storage for your Google Account, used for Original Quality photos and videos by subscribing to Google One. Subscriptions start at $1.99/month for 100 GB in the US. Pricing and availability can vary by region.

- Google One Terms of Service: https://one.google.com/terms-of-service
- One Google Pricing: https://one.google.com/about

For additional help visit https://support.google.com/photos

Google Photos is also available on Wear OS for the Google Pixel Watch. Set your favorite photos as your watch face.

*Face grouping, live albums and photo books are not available in all countries.

app.summary: The home for your memories. Relive, share, and organize your photos.

reviews.text: Very good app. I like how it's very efficient and user friendly. Two issues though: 1. It doesn't support displaying TIFF or PSD. I would at least like TIFF support in a future update. 2. Wish there was an option for "Free Up Space" to put certain folders in a "Do not delete from device" list. If these could be added in a future update, I will change my rating from 4 to 5.

I've been using Google Photos for years now and it's one of the best things ever! I never have to worry about losing my photos OR videos From my phone, tablet, or COMPUTER! People are always amazed I have photos from 1996 in my phone. I don't! It's Google Photos!!! I love being able to search through my thousands of photos and videos easily By name, by thing (like dancing) and sometimes by pet. Unfortunately, face recognition no longer works for pets very well. That was great!

love Google Photos app. They have great ways to make short films or reels of pictures up to 50 in a short. You can make cloages .I like to use my pictures to post on Facebook in the reels section. It's just all around fun if you have a creative mind. So give it a try It's free. You can purchase your pictures if you wish to. I have gotten some prints and they are perfect. They come in different sizes to choose from also . I have been with this program for years and I have not been disappointed .

I really love how this app allows me to integrate my photos on Google supported devices. I would ask for two improvements. First. searching using the description I put in. I enter what the subject is, so I should be able to easily find that picture again, but no such luck. Second, in editing to just allow a little more control in the editing process. I can get much better results from other editors like Luminar.

The photo recap for this year was EXCELLENT!? It made me feel like I was getting the most from this app. The way it categorized them was kinda neat in my opinion. I still am a bit confused on how to keep specific photos from disappearing from my gallery once I back them up to Google Photos, but I'm thinking more and that might be a me issue. 😅 Maybe I should be making the albums on here? Could be the fix. 🤷🏼
reviews.replyText: Hi there. We're sorry to hear you're having trouble. We suggest that you take a look at this article: goo.gle/37eSSXM to fix problems with the app. Also, See here for more on how deletion works: goo.gle/39VUrfT. If that won't fix the issue you can ask our experts on the Help forum: goo.gle/3o5JIVl. Hope that helps.

reviews.text: Recently, after deleting photos, the "Moved to Trash/Undo" banner hovered far too long w/ no way to dismiss it & delete next pic. Thnx Google for a quick fix in response to my review rant!😁 Last update to Automatic Highlights or "look back" reels feels downgraded, w/landscape-oriented pix smushed into tiny portrait mode versions & we can't view the individual pix within the presentation. Also, please provide quick & easy option to skip trash & permanently delete certain selected photos.
reviews.replyText: Hi Sarah. Thank you for letting us know! We've resolved the issue with "Move to Trash" banner and it should now work as expected.

reviews.text: Not sure if I like the update to the search feature 🤔... I went to search today and was confused. I feel the previous search was a lot more accurate. This time it gave me a bunch of random photos that were not related to what I entered. Otherwise I love google photos. It keeps all of my photos in one place. I love the albums I share with my family. We all have an album that we share together, and it is great.

*Edit -- Feedback left via the app* Everything is pretty good, but please quit asking me if I want to backup all of my photos every other time I open the app. I pay for the app and use it to backup certain photos, and I don't want to backup ALL of my phone's photos...EVER! Not to mention that another pop-up shows up having my photos selected with a big button to backup and only a small button to reject this option.
reviews.replyText: Sorry for the inconvenience, Ross. We value your feedback. Feel free to share feedback with us here: https://goo.gle/3gaHLEz.

reviews.text: insane design. I didn't want my photos backed up for a reason. because I don't want to have happen exactly what did when I accidentally hit the backup button it throws in front of you everytime you open it, no matter now many times you decline. It hijacks your photos on your device, then runs out of storage and cant use any apps. then you pay for more storage or delete them, only deleting them means losing them altogether. Predatory design. Lost some good memories. Completely unforgivable.

The app is fine. I'd just like it if it could play things in the background, if when I hide things and decide to play it on a different app it doesn't make me have to download it again, and it would be organized. It keeps putting my screenshots with everything else. Please fix these problems. edit: they fixed all the problems, the app is perfectly fine now
reviews.replyText: Hi Milene. Follow these steps to download a photo or video to your device: https://goo.gle/3TcIzwM. If the photo or video is already stored on your device, you won’t see the option to download this in Google Photos. Also, feel free to share feedback with us here: https://goo.gle/3gaHLEz.

app.developerLegalAddress: 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy, Mountain View, CA 94043, United States
app.recentChanges: We are introducing a new storage management tool to help you easily manage the photos that count toward your storage quota. This tool will surface photos or videos you might want to delete — like blurry photos, screenshots and large videos.
app.AIReview:
Google Photos Review – A Comprehensive Analysis

Overview

Google Photos is, without question, the dominant player in the mobile photo storage and management space. With over 11.6 billion installs and a robust user base of 52 million+, its continued success speaks volumes about its functionality, ease of use, and integration with Google’s ecosystem. The app's core mission – to provide a safe haven for your photos and videos while streamlining organization and sharing – has resonated deeply with millions. It’s a flagship product for Google and consistently receives significant updates, reflecting an ongoing commitment to improvement. This review delves into the various facets of Google Photos, evaluating its strengths, weaknesses, and overall value proposition for users seeking a comprehensive photo management solution.

Key Features

Google Photos is packed with features designed to cater to both casual snapshooters and more serious photographers. Here’s a breakdown of the key offerings:

  • Automatic Backup: The cornerstone of Google Photos remains its automatic backup functionality. Utilizing cloud storage, it seamlessly uploads photos and videos from your device as you take them, freeing up valuable local storage space.
  • Shared Albums: Easily create and share albums with family and friends, granting them viewing or editing permissions. Collaboration is facilitated through real-time updates – changes made by one user are instantly reflected for everyone else in the album.
  • Google Lens Integration: A powerful addition allowing users to identify objects, text, and landmarks within photos using Google's image recognition technology. This feature extends beyond simple object identification, offering information about locations, products, and more.
  • Automatic Creations (Memories): The app intelligently generates “Memories” – collages and short videos highlighting significant moments from your photo library based on location, time, and people detected within the images.
  • Advanced Editing Suite: Google Photos provides a surprisingly robust editing suite directly within the app. Users can adjust brightness, contrast, color, apply filters, crop, rotate, and even perform more advanced edits like healing tools to remove blemishes or unwanted objects. It includes over 30+ filters and effects.
  • Search by Face Recognition: Google Photos' facial recognition technology allows users to search for photos of specific individuals with remarkable accuracy, significantly simplifying the task of finding pictures of loved ones.
  • RAW Support: For serious photography enthusiasts, Google Photos now supports importing and editing RAW image files (like .DNG), offering greater control over color grading and detail retrieval.

Strengths

  • Seamless Integration: The deep integration with other Google services – Drive, Gmail, and more – is a major strength. Accessing and managing photos within the Google ecosystem feels natural and intuitive.
  • Reliable Backup: The automatic backup feature is exceptionally reliable, providing peace of mind knowing your memories are safe in the cloud.
  • Powerful Editing Tools: The built-in editing tools rival many dedicated photo editing apps, offering a surprisingly comprehensive set of features without requiring users to switch applications.
  • Google Lens’ Utility: Google Lens dramatically expands the app's functionality beyond simple picture storage – it's genuinely useful.
  • Large Storage Capacity: The 15GB free storage provided with a Google Account is a significant draw, particularly for users who take a lot of photos and videos.

Areas for Improvement

  • Storage Management: While the initial 15GB is generous, managing storage can become tricky as your library grows. The interface for viewing and deleting large numbers of photos could be improved.
  • Offline Access Limitations: While Google Photos allows you to download albums for offline viewing, the selection of photos available for offline access isn't always clear or intuitive.
  • Filter Selection Clarity: While there are many filters, some can be difficult to distinguish visually within the app itself, making it harder to find the perfect one.
  • RAW Processing Speed: While RAW support is a welcome addition, processing speeds could be faster and more refined for complex edits.

User Experience

The user experience in Google Photos is generally excellent – intuitive, clean, and responsive. The interface is well-organized, making it easy to navigate through your photo library, create albums, edit photos, and share them with others. The "Memories" feature is a delightful surprise that adds a layer of nostalgia and engagement. However, the sheer volume of features can occasionally feel overwhelming for new users, requiring some time to learn the nuances of each function. The app’s performance is consistently smooth across a range of devices, although occasional lag can occur when processing large batches of photos or videos, particularly during editing.

Value for Money

Google Photos is fundamentally free to use, offering 15GB of storage with a Google Account. This makes it incredibly attractive to most users. Additional storage plans are available through Google One, providing flexible options for expanding your storage capacity at competitive prices. Considering the app’s functionality and the value provided, it represents exceptional value for money, especially when compared to subscription-based photo storage services.

Conclusion

Google Photos remains a powerhouse in the mobile photography landscape. Its combination of automatic backup, intelligent organization, powerful editing tools, and seamless integration with Google's ecosystem makes it an indispensable app for anyone who captures memories digitally. While there are minor areas for improvement, the strengths significantly outweigh the weaknesses. With its massive user base and continued development, Google Photos is undoubtedly "the best photo product on Earth," as The Verge suggests – a testament to its enduring appeal and effectiveness. It’s a highly recommended app that deserves a 4.5/5 rating based on its functionality and overall value proposition.
